edu.rit.pjmr

Class Reducer<K,V extends Vbl>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pjmr.Reducer<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Output key data type.
    V - Output value data type; must implement interface Vbl.

    public abstract class Reducer<K,V extends Vbl>
extends Object
    Class Reducer is the abstract base class for a reducer in the Parallel Java Map Reduce Framework. See class PjmrJob for further information about configuring reducers as part of a PJMR job.

    A ReducerTask calls a reducer's methods as follows:

    1. The reducer task calls the reducer's start() method. The arguments are the reducer's argument strings if any. The start() method may initialize the reducer based on the argument strings.

    2. The reducer task repeatedly calls the reducer's reduce() method. The arguments are a (key, value) pair from a Combiner. The combiner holds the combined contents of all the mappers' combiners in the PJMR job. The reduce() method may do whatever it likes with the (key, value) pair, such as doing computations on the pair, printing the pair, or storing the pair in a file. The reduce() method may alter the state of the value (but not the key).

    3. When all pairs have been processed, the reducer task calls the reducer's finish() method. The finish() method may do postprocessing operations.

    If a reducer task has more than one reducer, the reducers are run in parallel in separate threads. There is one global combiner, and the reducers share the work of processing the pairs in the combiner.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Reducer

        public Reducer()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(String[] args)
        Start this reducer.

        The base class start() method does nothing. A subclass may override the start() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        args - Array of zero or more argument strings.

      • reduce

        public abstract void reduce(K key,
          V value)
        Reduce the given (key, value) pair. The state of the key must not be altered. The state of the value may be altered.

        The reduce() method must be overridden in a subclass.

        Parameters:
        key - Key; non-null.
        value - Value; may be null.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Finish this reducer.

        The base class finish() method does nothing. A subclass may override the finish() method to do something.
